text:
Environment:
1)Apache 1.3.29 built from FreeBSD ports.
2)FreeBSD 4.8
3)httpd.conf is httpd.conf.default with 'CoreDumpDirectory /var/tmp' line added

Problem:
After sending SIGSEGV to one of the apache slave proccesses following appears 
in httpd-error.log:
[Fri Jan  9 16:16:54 2004] [notice] child pid 63625 exit signal Segmentation 
fault (11)
but there is no core in CoreDumpDirectory

P.S. I've enough room in /var/tmp and default process limits
(coredumpsize = infinity)
creator: nepal@megasoft.ru
trawick@apache.org
text:
This is a question for a user list, not the bug system.

Check:

* ulimit -c set appropriately in the shell that started Apache (possibly limits
related to file size are interesting too)
* CoredumpDirectory set to directory with plenty of space and permissions which
allow child processes (web server user and group) to write to it
* if Apache is started as root on FreeBSD:
set kern.sugid_coredump variable via sysctl

creator: nepal@megasoft.ru
text:
Thanks!

Setting kern.sugid_coredump=1 does help.
Sorry for annoyance.
